alert.note: Alert for Butler; Grayson; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 13 at 7:26PM EDT until April 13 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Butler County in south central Kentucky... Western Grayson County in central Kentucky... East central Ohio County in central Kentucky... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 626 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 9 miles east of Hartford, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Butler, western Grayson and east central Ohio Counties, including the following locations... Horse Branch, Steff, Tousey, Windy Hill, Caneyville, Flint Springs, Do Stop, Neafus, Pine Knob and Black Rock. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
